title: I'm sick of people who are surprised when they get support
body:
So story time

I picked Top and Mid as my two roles, after a wait I am brought into the game and this one player asks if he could jungle. Not really asked, more like demanded.

The guy who got jungle said "no" as most people would, he queued with his role, he waited, it only makes sense that he keeps it.

Then the player started getting pissy because he didn't "choose support" he picked fill.

Me and the jungler laughed at this, mostly because we both knew that "fill" means "support" in the language of Dynamic Que.

The "Fill" started saying "GG" and "Well I'm going to feed then" to which by the end of the bans, our last player dodged.

Look, I get it, it's not fun not playing the role you want, but Dynamic queue is here for a reason, pick the roles you want and don't act annoyed when you get Support when you picked Fill.

replies.body:
I think _Fill _ is something like: Support => Jungle => ADC => Top => Mid

But yeah. Fill = Support 90% of the times
Pretty much. I always choose "Fill", shortens the queue times immensely (nothing more than 20 seconds).
Have barely played any Dynamic Queue ranked but I've had people in blind pick be like "Fill", then decline support role when the other 4 roles have been taken. Pretty stupid.
